chi_squared_calculation._scaling_optimization_note: Scaling optimization is always enabled: g₂ = offset + contrast × g₁. This is essential for proper chi-squared calculation regardless of mode or number of angles.

_scaling_details._purpose: Performs least squares fitting to determine contrast and offset parameters
_scaling_details._chi_squared_formula: χ² = Σ(experimental - fitted)²/σ² where fitted = theory × contrast + offset
_scaling_details._implementation: Uses numpy.linalg.lstsq to solve A·x = b where A = [theory, ones], x = [contrast, offset]

parameter_estimation_tips: D0: Estimate from single-particle measurements or literature
alpha: Start with 0 (constant diffusion), adjust for time dependence
D_offset: Usually small compared to D0
gamma_dot_t0: Estimate from applied shear rate or rheology
beta: Start with 0 (steady flow) for constant shear systems
phi0: Start near 0, represents geometry alignment
performance_considerations: Computational cost scales with number of angles and parameters
Angle filtering provides 3-5x speedup with minimal accuracy loss
MCMC sampling is computationally intensive but valuable
Per-angle scaling optimization improves fit quality
